title: Wire up macro execution pipeline
description: Connect parser, executor, command handlers, and DOM executors so macros actually execute end-to-end
close_reason: Implemented browser bridge, command handlers, and wired up execution pipeline

title: iMacros Chrome MV3 Migration
description: Migrate iMacros Firefox 8.9.7 (XUL/XPCOM extension) to Chrome Manifest V3 with 100% feature parity using Electron Native Host + Chrome Extension architecture.

title: Project Setup & Infrastructure
description: Initialize project structure, build tools, and development environment for both Electron Native Host and Chrome Extension.

title: Initialize monorepo structure
description: Create project root with native-host/, extension/, shared/, tests/ directories. Set up package.json with workspaces.
acceptance_criteria: - Monorepo structure created\n- package.json configured for workspaces\n- .gitignore set up

title: Set up TypeScript configuration
description: Configure TypeScript for both Electron and Chrome extension with shared types.
acceptance_criteria: - tsconfig.json for each package\n- Shared types compile correctly

title: Configure Vite build system
description: Set up Vite for bundling native host, extension service worker, content scripts, and side panel.
acceptance_criteria: - Build produces working extension\n- Build produces working Electron app

title: Create Chrome extension manifest.json
description: Create MV3 manifest with permissions for tabs, storage, sidePanel, webRequest, nativeMessaging, declarativeNetRequest.
acceptance_criteria: - Extension loads in Chrome without errors\n- All required permissions declared

title: Set up Electron package.json and main.js
description: Initialize Electron app with electron-builder config. Configure for native messaging stdio mode.
acceptance_criteria: - Electron app launches\n- electron-builder config complete

title: Electron Native Host - Foundation
description: Set up Electron application with Native Messaging, system tray, and basic services.

title: Implement Native Messaging stdio protocol
description: Handle Chrome native messaging protocol: 32-bit length prefix, JSON encoding/decoding over stdin/stdout. Use native-messaging npm package.
acceptance_criteria: - Extension can send message to host\n- Host responds correctly\n- Binary protocol handled correctly

title: Implement system tray integration
description: Create system tray icon with menu. Show status (idle/recording/playing). Option to open debugger, quit.
acceptance_criteria: - Tray icon appears\n- Menu works\n- Status updates

title: Implement file service
description: File system operations: readFile, writeFile, readdir (recursive), unlink, mkdir. Handle all charset encodings from original iMacros (UTF-8, UTF-16, Windows codepages).
acceptance_criteria: - All file operations work\n- Charset detection matches original\n- Directory listing works

title: Register imacros:// protocol handler
description: Use Electron app.setAsDefaultProtocolClient() to register imacros:// URLs. Parse URL and trigger macro execution.
acceptance_criteria: - Protocol registered on install\n- imacros://run?m=test.iim triggers playback

title: Implement TCP Scripting Interface server
description: TCP server on configurable port (default 4951) for external program control. Handle iimPlay, iimSet, iimGetLastExtract, iimGetLastError commands.
acceptance_criteria: - Server starts on configured port\n- All SI commands work\n- Returns correct codes

title: Macro Engine
description: Implement macro parser, variable system, command handlers, and execution engine in Native Host.

title: Implement macro parser
description: Port RegExpTable from MacroPlayer.js. Parse all 40+ iMacros commands. Handle comments, blank lines, variable syntax.
acceptance_criteria:
- All 40+ commands parse correctly
- Variable syntax {{var}} detected
- Comments ignored
- Error messages for invalid syntax

title: Implement flow control command handlers
description: WAIT SECONDS=n, PAUSE (show dialog), PROMPT (input dialog). Handle !TIMEOUT_TAG retry logic.
acceptance_criteria:
- WAIT delays correctly
- PAUSE shows dialog
- PROMPT gets input
- Timeout retry works

title: Implement dialog command handlers
description: ONDIALOG BUTTON=, ONLOGIN USER= PASSWORD=, ONCERTIFICATEDIALOG, ONERRORDIALOG, ONSECURITYDIALOG, ONWEBPAGEDIALOG, ONPRINT.
acceptance_criteria: - Alert/confirm/prompt intercepted\n- HTTP auth handled\n- All dialog types work

title: Implement download command handlers
description: ONDOWNLOAD FOLDER= FILE=, SAVEAS TYPE= FOLDER= FILE=, SAVEITEM. Coordinate with extension chrome.downloads API.
acceptance_criteria: - Downloads go to specified folder\n- SAVEAS creates files\n- SAVEITEM works

title: Implement file command handlers
description: FILEDELETE NAME=. Use file service for operations.
acceptance_criteria: - Files delete correctly

title: Implement browser command handlers
description: CLEAR (cookies/cache), FILTER TYPE=IMAGES/FLASH, PROXY ADDRESS=, SCREENSHOT. Use extension APIs.
acceptance_criteria:
- Clear works
- Filter blocks content
- Proxy sets correctly
- Screenshot captures

title: Implement system command handlers
description: CMDLINE (child_process), DISCONNECT/REDIAL (OS-specific), STOPWATCH, VERSION.
acceptance_criteria: - CMDLINE executes commands\n- STOPWATCH times correctly\n- VERSION returns info

title: Implement variable system
description: !VAR0-9, !EXTRACT, !EXTRACTADD, !LOOP, !DATASOURCE*, !TIMEOUT*, custom variables. Variable expansion with {{var}} syntax.
acceptance_criteria:
- All built-in variables work
- Custom variables work
- Expansion in all command parameters
- ADD command works

title: Implement safe expression evaluator
description: Replace eval() with expr-eval library. Support arithmetic, string concatenation, variable references. No code injection possible.
acceptance_criteria: - Math expressions evaluate\n- String concat works\n- No security vulnerabilities

title: Implement CSV datasource parser
description: Parse CSV files using papaparse. Support !COL1, !COL2, etc. Handle different delimiters, quoted fields, headers.
acceptance_criteria: - CSV files load correctly\n- !COLn variables populated\n- Different delimiters work

title: Implement state manager
description: Track macro execution state: current line, loop counter, variables, extract data, error code. Persist state for resume.
acceptance_criteria: - State persists during execution\n- Can serialize/deserialize state

title: Implement macro execution loop
description: Main execution engine: parse macro, expand variables, execute commands, handle errors, manage loops, report progress.
acceptance_criteria: - Macros execute line by line\n- Loops work correctly\n- Errors reported with correct codes

title: Implement navigation command handlers
description: URL GOTO/CURRENT, BACK, REFRESH, TAB (T=n/OPEN/CLOSE/CLOSEALLOTHERS), FRAME F=n. Communicate with extension for browser operations.
acceptance_criteria: - All navigation commands work\n- Tab operations work\n- Frame selection works

title: Implement interaction command handlers
description: TAG command with all params (POS, TYPE, ATTR, CONTENT, EXTRACT, XPATH, CSS). CLICK X=Y. EVENT TYPE=. Send to content script.
acceptance_criteria:
- TAG finds elements correctly
- Content fills work
- Clicks work
- XPath/CSS selectors work

title: Implement extraction command handlers
description: EXTRACT (TXT/HTM/HREF/etc), SEARCH SOURCE=TXT/REGEXP. Store in !EXTRACT. Handle multiple extractions with [EXTRACT] delimiter.
acceptance_criteria:
- Text extraction works
- HTML extraction works
- SEARCH with regex works
- Multiple extracts concatenate

title: Content Scripts
description: Chrome extension content scripts for DOM interaction, recording, and element finding.

title: Implement element finder
description: Find elements by: XPath, CSS selector, TAG POS TYPE ATTR. Handle wildcards (*), TXT: for text content, all attribute types. Position handling (POS=1, POS=-1).
acceptance_criteria:
- XPath finding works
- CSS selector works
- Attribute matching with wildcards
- POS positive and negative
- TXT: matching works

title: Implement event dispatcher
description: Dispatch synthetic events: MouseEvent (click, mousedown, mouseup), KeyboardEvent (keypress, keydown, keyup), InputEvent, FocusEvent. Handle modifiers.
acceptance_criteria:
- Clicks trigger handlers
- Keyboard events work
- Input events fire
- Modifiers (Ctrl/Alt/Shift) work

title: Implement DOM executor
description: Receive commands from native host. Execute TAG, CLICK, EVENT commands. Return results (success, extracted data, errors).
acceptance_criteria: - Commands execute on page\n- Results returned to host\n- Errors reported correctly

title: Implement macro recorder
description: Capture user interactions: clicks, form changes, keyboard input. Generate TAG commands with correct POS/TYPE/ATTR. Send recorded events to native host.
acceptance_criteria: - Clicks recorded as TAG\n- Form inputs recorded\n- Generated macros are playable

title: Implement dialog interceptor
description: Override window.alert/confirm/prompt to handle ONDIALOG. Auto-respond based on settings. Report dialog events to host.
acceptance_criteria: - alert() intercepted\n- confirm() returns correct value\n- prompt() returns input or default

title: Implement data extractor
description: Extract TXT (innerText), HTM (innerHTML), HREF, SRC, and other attributes. Handle multiple extractions with delimiter.
acceptance_criteria: - Text extraction works\n- HTML extraction works\n- All attributes extractable

title: Implement frame handling
description: Support FRAME F=n command. Track current frame. Execute commands in correct frame context.
acceptance_criteria: - Frame selection works\n- Commands run in selected frame\n- Nested frames supported

title: Chrome Extension UI
description: Side Panel, macro editor, options page, and extension service worker.

title: Implement service worker message relay
description: Relay messages between content scripts and native host. Handle tab management (create, switch, close). Manage connection lifecycle.
acceptance_criteria: - Messages relay correctly\n- Connection stable\n- Tab operations work

title: Implement side panel UI
description: Create panel.html with macro file tree, Play/Record/Stop buttons, status bar, loop counter, line counter. Style to match original iMacros.
acceptance_criteria: - Panel opens in Chrome\n- All controls visible\n- Looks like original

title: Implement file tree component
description: Display macro directory tree from native host. Support expand/collapse folders. Select macro to play/edit. Refresh button.
acceptance_criteria: - Tree displays files\n- Folders expand/collapse\n- Selection works

title: Implement status synchronization
description: Sync UI state with native host: playing/recording/idle status, current line, loop count, error messages.
acceptance_criteria: - Status updates in real-time\n- Line number updates\n- Errors display

title: Implement macro editor page
description: Editor page with CodeMirror/Monaco. Syntax highlighting for .iim files. Save/load via native host. New macro creation.
acceptance_criteria: - Editor opens macros\n- Syntax highlighting works\n- Save/load works

title: Implement options page
description: Settings page for: macro folder paths, recording options, timeout defaults, encryption settings, SI port. Sync with chrome.storage and native host.
acceptance_criteria: - All settings configurable\n- Settings persist\n- Native host receives updates

title: Implement web request handlers
description: Handle ONLOGIN via chrome.webRequest.onAuthRequired. Implement FILTER via chrome.declarativeNetRequest rules.
acceptance_criteria: - HTTP auth auto-handled\n- Image/Flash filtering works

title: Advanced Features
description: Image search, credential storage, registry access, printing, JS debugger.

title: Implement IMAGESEARCH
description: Image template matching using sharp or opencv4nodejs. Load template image, capture screen region, find match location, return coordinates.
acceptance_criteria: - Template matching works\n- Returns coordinates\n- Confidence threshold works

title: Implement credential storage
description: Use Electron safeStorage or keytar for secure password storage. Support master password, session keys, encrypted variables.
acceptance_criteria: - Passwords stored securely\n- Master password works\n- Encryption matches original

title: Implement Rijndael encryption
description: Port or use rijndael-js for AES encryption compatible with original iMacros. Encrypt/decrypt variables and passwords.
acceptance_criteria: - Encryption works\n- Compatible with original\n- Decryption works

title: Implement Windows registry access
description: Use registry-js to read iMacros paths and settings from Windows registry (HKLM\SOFTWARE\iOpus\iMacros).
acceptance_criteria: - Registry reads work\n- Paths retrieved correctly

title: Implement PRINT command with Puppeteer
description: Use Puppeteer to render page and print to PDF or physical printer. Support print settings from ONPRINT.
acceptance_criteria: - PDF generation works\n- Print to printer works\n- Settings applied

title: Implement JavaScript macro debugger
description: Electron window for JS macro debugging. Parse JS with Acorn. Instrument code for step-through. Breakpoints, variable inspection, call stack.
acceptance_criteria:
- Step-through works
- Breakpoints work
- Variables inspectable
- iimPlay/iimSet/iimGetLastExtract work

title: Implement WINCLICK with nut.js
description: OS-level mouse click using nut.js. Click at absolute screen coordinates regardless of browser focus.
acceptance_criteria: - Clicks work at coordinates\n- Works outside browser

title: Testing & Quality Assurance
description: Unit tests, integration tests, E2E tests, sample macro verification.

title: Set up test infrastructure
description: Configure Vitest for unit tests, Puppeteer for E2E. Create test utilities, fixtures server, mock helpers.
acceptance_criteria: - npm run test works\n- Test server runs\n- Mocks available

title: Set up CI pipeline
description: GitHub Actions workflow: unit tests, integration tests, E2E tests. Run on Windows, macOS, Linux.
acceptance_criteria: - CI runs on push\n- All platforms tested\n- Status badges work

title: Write parser unit tests
description: Test parsing of all 40+ commands. Test error handling for invalid syntax. Test variable detection.
acceptance_criteria: - All commands have tests\n- Edge cases covered\n- 100% parser coverage

title: Write variable system unit tests
description: Test !VAR0-9, custom vars, !EXTRACT, !LOOP, !DATASOURCE. Test expansion, ADD, edge cases.
acceptance_criteria: - All variable types tested\n- Expansion tested\n- Edge cases covered

title: Write element finder unit tests
description: Test XPath, CSS, attribute matching. Test wildcards, POS handling, TXT: matching.
acceptance_criteria: - All finder methods tested\n- Edge cases covered

title: Write command integration tests
description: Test each command category: navigation, interaction, extraction, flow, dialogs, downloads, browser, system.
acceptance_criteria: - All commands tested in browser\n- Real DOM interactions verified

title: Write native messaging integration tests
description: Test message relay between extension and host. Test all message types. Test error handling.
acceptance_criteria: - All message types tested\n- Connection lifecycle tested

title: Write Scripting Interface tests
description: Test TCP server: iimPlay, iimSet, iimGetLastExtract, iimGetLastError. Test concurrent connections.
acceptance_criteria: - All SI commands tested\n- Return codes correct

title: Write recording E2E tests
description: Test recording clicks, form fills, navigation. Verify recorded macros play back correctly.
acceptance_criteria: - Recording produces valid macros\n- Playback matches actions

title: Verify all 31 sample macros
description: Run each original sample macro. Compare results with Firefox version. Document any differences.
acceptance_criteria: - All 31 samples pass\n- Results match Firefox\n- Differences documented

title: Distribution & Installers
description: Build installers for Windows, macOS, Linux that bundle extension and native host.

title: Configure electron-builder
description: Set up electron-builder.json for Windows (NSIS), macOS (DMG), Linux (AppImage, DEB). Configure signing, auto-update.
acceptance_criteria: - Builds produce installers\n- All platforms build\n- Signing configured

title: Create Windows installer
description: NSIS installer: install Electron app, register native messaging manifest in registry, register imacros:// protocol, prompt for extension install.
acceptance_criteria: - Installer works on Windows\n- Native messaging registered\n- Protocol registered

title: Create macOS installer
description: DMG with drag-to-Applications. First-run registers native messaging and protocol. Notarization for Gatekeeper.
acceptance_criteria: - DMG installs correctly\n- First-run setup works\n- Notarization passes

title: Create Linux packages
description: AppImage for universal, DEB for Debian/Ubuntu, RPM for Fedora/RHEL. Desktop entry, native messaging manifest.
acceptance_criteria: - All formats build\n- Desktop entry works\n- Native messaging works

title: Prepare Chrome Web Store submission
description: Create store listing: description, screenshots, privacy policy. Package extension as .zip. Submit for review.
acceptance_criteria: - Listing complete\n- Extension submitted\n- Review passed

title: Create documentation
description: User guide, command reference, migration guide from Firefox version, developer documentation.
acceptance_criteria: - User guide complete\n- Command reference complete\n- Migration guide complete

title: ONLOGIN command (HTTP auth)
description:
Verify ONLOGIN USER/PASSWORD intercepts HTTP 401 authentication challenges and provides credentials automatically.

Files: shared/src/commands/dialogs.ts, extension/src/background/web-request-handlers.ts

Original behavior: ONLOGIN USER=myuser PASSWORD=mypass sets up credentials for the next HTTP 401 authentication challenge. Uses chrome.webRequest.onAuthRequired to intercept and respond.

REQUIREMENTS:
(1) NO STUBBING - implementation must actually work.
(2) Must have integration tests with mock HTTP auth challenge.
(3) Tests must run and pass before marking this issue complete.

title: TAB command (T, OPEN, CLOSE, CLOSEALLOTHERS)
description:
Verify TAB T=n switches to the nth tab. Verify TAB OPEN creates a new tab. Verify TAB CLOSE closes the current tab. Verify TAB CLOSEALLOTHERS closes all tabs except the current one.

Files: shared/src/commands/navigation.ts, extension/src/background.ts

Original behavior: TAB T=2 switches to the second tab. TAB OPEN opens a new blank tab. TAB CLOSE closes the active tab. TAB CLOSEALLOTHERS closes all other tabs.

REQUIREMENTS:
(1) NO STUBBING - implementation must actually work.
(2) Must have integration tests for each variant (T, OPEN, CLOSE, CLOSEALLOTHERS).
(3) Tests must run and pass before marking this issue complete.

title: VERSION command
description:
Verify BUILD= version comparison works. Verify !VERSION, !VERSION_MAJOR, !VERSION_MINOR, !VERSION_PATCH, and !PLATFORM variables are correctly populated.

Files: shared/src/commands/system.ts

Original behavior: VERSION BUILD=8.9.7 checks if the current iMacros version matches or exceeds the specified build number. !VERSION returns the full version string. !VERSION_MAJOR, !VERSION_MINOR, !VERSION_PATCH return individual components. !PLATFORM returns the OS platform.

REQUIREMENTS:
(1) NO STUBBING - implementation must actually work.
(2) Must have integration tests for version comparison and variable population.
(3) Tests must run and pass before marking this issue complete.

title: Implement UnsupportedCommand errors for originally-unsupported commands
description:
For 1:1 parity with original iMacros Firefox 8.9.7, these commands should return proper UnsupportedCommand error codes instead of silently failing or crashing:

- DS
- IMAGECLICK
- ONCERTIFICATEDIALOG
- ONPRINT
- ONSECURITYDIALOG
- ONWEBPAGEDIALOG
- PRINT
- SIZE
- WINCLICK
- DISCONNECT
- REDIAL
- Standalone EXTRACT (without TAG)
- IMAGESEARCH (non-Windows)

Note: Some of these have native host implementations (winclick-service, image-search) that could be enabled later as enhancements beyond parity. For now, they should return the same UnsupportedCommand error the original extension returned.

Files: shared/src/executor.ts or individual command handlers

REQUIREMENTS:
(1) Must return proper UnsupportedCommand error code matching original behavior.
(2) Must have unit tests verifying each command returns the correct error code.
(3) Tests must run and pass before marking this issue complete.

title: SET and ADD commands
description:
Verify SET for user vars (!VAR0-9), system vars (!TIMEOUT, !ERRORIGNORE, etc.). Verify SET with EVAL() expressions. Verify ADD numeric accumulation.

Files: shared/src/commands/interaction.ts (SET handler in executor), shared/src/variables.ts

Original behavior: SET !VAR1 value assigns a variable. SET !TIMEOUT 10 sets system timeout. SET !VAR1 EVAL("{{!VAR1}}+1") evaluates expressions. ADD !VAR1 5 adds to existing numeric value.

REQUIREMENTS:
(1) NO STUBBING - implementation must actually work.
(2) Must have unit + integration tests for all variable types.
(3) Tests must run and pass before marking this issue complete.

title: Scripting Interface macro execution
description:
Wire iimPlay handler to actually execute macros through the extension. Verify iimSet, iimGetLastExtract, iimGetLastError, iimStop, iimExit all work.

Files: native-host/src/services/scripting-interface.ts, native-host/native-host.js

Original behavior: External programs connect to TCP port 4951 and send commands: iimPlay(macro) runs a macro and returns status code. iimSet(var, value) sets a variable. iimGetLastExtract() returns !EXTRACT value. iimGetLastError() returns last error code/message. iimStop() stops current macro. iimExit() shuts down iMacros.

REQUIREMENTS:
(1) NO STUBBING - implementation must actually work.
(2) Must have integration tests connecting to TCP server and running macros.
(3) Tests must run and pass before marking this issue complete.
(4) Verify full round-trip: connect -> set variable -> play macro -> get extract -> disconnect.

Original behavior: FILTER TYPE=IMAGES STATUS=ON blocks image loading on pages. FILTER TYPE=FLASH STATUS=ON blocks Flash/media content. FILTER TYPE=POPUPS STATUS=ON blocks popup windows. Uses chrome.declarativeNetRequest rules to block matching requests.

REQUIREMENTS:
(1) NO STUBBING - implementation must actually work.
(2) Must have integration tests verifying request blocking for each filter type.
(3) Tests must run and pass before marking this issue complete.

title: CLICK command (X, Y coordinates)
description:
Verify CLICK at screen coordinates with left/right/middle buttons dispatches correct mouse events to the element at those coordinates.

Files: shared/src/commands/interaction.ts, extension/src/content/dom-executor.ts

Original behavior: CLICK X=100 Y=200 clicks at the specified coordinates. Supports BUTTON=LEFT/RIGHT/MIDDLE for different mouse buttons.

REQUIREMENTS:
(1) NO STUBBING - implementation must actually work.
(2) Must have integration tests against positioned elements.
(3) Tests must run and pass before marking this issue complete.

title: End-to-end macro execution pipeline
description:
Wire executor -> native host -> background.ts -> content script -> back. Verify a simple macro (URL GOTO + TAG EXTRACT) executes through the full pipeline from native host command to DOM interaction and result return.

Files: native-host/native-host.js, extension/src/background.ts, shared/src/executor.ts

Original behavior: Macro commands flow from engine through native messaging to extension service worker, which dispatches to content scripts for DOM operations, then results flow back.

REQUIREMENTS:
(1) NO STUBBING - implementation must actually work end-to-end.
(2) Must have E2E test executing a multi-command macro against a test page.
(3) Tests must run and pass before marking this issue complete.
(4) Verify the full round-trip: parse macro -> execute commands -> native host relay -> background.ts dispatch -> content script DOM operation -> result return.
